review: Ну что сказать про эту игру? Несомненно у неё есть целый ряд плюсов. Начнем с очевидного: Визуальное оформление. Оно шикарно! Оно ненавязчивое и тем не менее цепляет и создает некий контраст с великолепным космическим фоном. В плане самого геймплея нет ничего революционного. Такие игры были и будут. В общем это очень хороший, а главное, качественный таймкиллер. Как по мне, так было бы круто выпустить эту игру ещё и на мобильные платформы. Спасибо разработчику за то, что он постарался над этой игрой, а ещё спасибо за ключ. Желаю вам успехов.

review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
Juego de puzzles de 30 niveles en los que tenes que hacer misiones, el juego te dice la mision   ej. recoger todas las esperas o romper todas las cajas explosivas, ir a la salida, etc.
Tenes Esferas que son recogidas al pasar por encima de ellas
Rebotadores tipo pinball (triángulos estacionarios)
Podes romper cajas tocandolas (timer que explota, son como bombas)
Cubos de vidrio que se rompen al tocarlos (tiene un solo rebote)
Hay Teleports de diferentes colores
Tenes Cubos fragmentados que cuando pasas por entre medio de ellos se cierran y se vuelve otro cubo duro en el cual chocas y podes redirigir a tu Cubo personaje.
Hay un Cubo que tiene luces en las 4 esquinas y las encendes tocándolas “golpeando” con el cubo desde esa direccion
Hay como Cubos amarillos transparentes que permiten encapsular al cubo tuyo y redirigirlo como si fuera el codito de plomería hacia otro lugar en 90º (podrían poner 2 cubos que bloqueen el paso y daría el mismo objetivo, pero bueno, existe este tipo de Cubo-Codito. En donde si toma relevancia es si pones varios y un Cubo amarillo (no códito) de 4 partes abiertas para poder redirigirte hacia cualquier lado (nivel 21 que aparece esto).
Hay puntos grises que al atravesarlos, se convierten en cubos de material que funcionan como cualquier Cubo y bloquean el paso.

La mecánica principal es que te moves en linea recta y vas chocando como el puzzle pug de Tapps.
Con esto logras resolver todos los niveles, no hay Workshop lo cual es una enorme lástima porque habría existido muchísimo más contenido y hubiera sido genial.
El juego esta bastante bueno, lindas mecánicas, música, graficos y sonidos interesantes, logros y cromos le dan Mas valor al titulo
Definitivamente vale la pena y se disfruta mucho  el titulo. Deberia haber una segunda entrega sin dudas
9/10 – Si te gustan los puzzles, cómpralo, no tiene desperdicio. Es bastante accesible economicamente.

review:
I played the previous version of this game (Orbox B) decades ago, loved it and still do. Nice that it found its way to Steam. Orbox has a special place in my heart for having developed my logical thinking as a kid. It has very challenging puzzles where the whole map is on the screen but the solution is not obvious to see. It is very well designed: evenly rising difficulty curve from tutorial easy to super challenging, fast movement, quick restarting, no undo button as every level can be done in 30 seconds and it's part of the experience, very well designed levels where there are many possible options but the correct solution is mostly only one of the options and is tricky to find and it's fun to search for it.

This is a little gem of a puzzle game! <3

review:
Orbox C, wins_84 ve gamebalance tarafından geliştirilen ve Trinity Project tarafından yayınlanan basit ama zorlu bir bulmaca oyunudur. Oyun hem bağımlılık yaratan hem de eğlenceli yenilikçi bir oyun konsepti sunuyor.

Orbox C'de oyuncular, bir duvara çarpana kadar düz bir çizgide hareket eden küçük bir kutuyu kontrol eder. Oyunun amacı, kutuyu giderek zorlaşan bir dizi labirentte yönlendirmek ve nihai hedefe ulaşmaktır. Oyuncular, yol boyunca engellerden ve tuzaklardan kaçınarak doğru yolu bulmak için mantık ve problem çözme becerilerini kullanmalıdır.

Oyunda her biri kendine özgü zorluklar ve engeller içeren toplam 150 seviye bulunmaktadır. Oyuncular oyunda ilerledikçe, oyuna derinlik ve karmaşıklık katan yeni mekanikler ve unsurlarla karşılaşacaklar. Grafikler ve ses efektleri minimalist ancak etkilidir, temiz ve cilalı bir görünüm ve his yaratır.

Genel olarak, Orbox C iyi bir mücadeleden hoşlanan bulmaca meraklıları için harika bir oyundur. Oynanış basit ancak ilgi çekici ve seviye tasarımı tatmin edici bir zorluk ilerlemesi sağlamak için iyi hazırlanmış. Eğlenceli ve bağımlılık yapıcı bir bulmaca oyunu arıyorsanız, Orbox C kesinlikle göz atmaya değer.

review:
Orbox C is a retro pixel 2D puzzle game which rips off Sokoban and a few other box moving games.  While there are quite a few levels in the game, which at least shows the devs put some effort in, they failed in a lot of other areas.  Fixed resolution, no quality settings, and they seem to have not noticed that these games have been available for decades and you can play them for free in Flash or in a web browser, all of which render this below minimum acceptable quality for a PC game.

Why pay money for this when you can play similar games for free?  Impossible to recommend.

The game itself is relatively simple to look at but it elevates itself with the amount of different mechanics they put into play and they do so quickly. I've only played through the easy mode so far but it's caught my attention and I found myself wanting to play more the further on I went. And this is from someone who normally doesn't play the puzzle genre!

And in that, this game has impressed me and there is a review/gameplay video on my Youtube channel as a result as it's worth a feature due to its ability to grasp even someone like me who doesn't normally play these types of games. I'm looking forward to seeing where the developers take this and the new challenges that'll come along.

So in closing I'd say the guys have made a nice little game here that can capture your attention and keep it there, good for the puzzle peeps out there definitely. Recommend it to anyone!

review:
I thought I would review This Product Again for a few reasons.

1:I feel I should be upfront I got this as a review copy for youtube years ago which I failed to make a video on (Since my laptop was having problems and some private life reasons)

And 2: Because I feel my Old review was far too vauge and seemed almost artifical to how i actually felt about the game even though my feelings where completely True.

I am writing Some parts before I replay The game, which before this point i finished 2 of the 8 worlds.

First the art style. Its simple and I mean that in the best way.
Im usually annoyed by overly flashy puzzle games because normally they focus more on graphics then you know, the puzzles.

As for the gameplay. I have just recently returned to this game and find the Gameplay itself is still really addictive for its type.
First off the game starts with a simple objective, Reach the goal.
However as you make your way through the game, new objectives get added and chaged out. then even get mixed making some actually uniqe and interesting puzzles.

I am a fairly big fan of puzzle games and I know these type of puzzles can be played free on websites.
However that being said this one in my opinion is still worth 3$. If I had one problem with this game it would possibly be the main menue feels a bit bare in its presentation.

I dont really have any gripes with this game, its a fun puzzle game and does its job well.

Overall I still stand by my old score of 7/10.
Its Above average in this kind of genre of puzzles.
its an average puzzle type but it does its job and does it well.

review:
Да что вы понимаете в современных играх?
Игра на логику для ценителей жанра и настоящих олдфагов в современной обертке. Проект - вылизанный до мельчайших деталей.

Спасибо разработчикам за шанс сделать обзор на эту игру. Они не ошиблись, что дали её именно мне, потому как я обожаю подобного рода игры. Я именно тот, кто будет в неё играть.

Прекрасный саундтрек, красивая и плавная анимация, не требовательна к железу, но в то же время обладает хорошей графикой. 
Продуманность каждого уровня с хорошим упором на психологию, очень трудно остановиться, затягивает с самого начала, хочется все новых свершений. Подойдет для любителей поломать голову и испытать себя. 

Из минусов могу отметить только отсутствие русского языка, потому как совсем тупенькие, а я в их числе, не всегда могут понять, сперва, что нужно делать. Прикрутить адаптацию и выбор языка.
Возможность сделать данную игру для смартфонов и планшетов дала бы не хилый толчок в продвижении игры в массы, ведь не каждый "Я" сядет вечерком погонять именно в это на компе. То ли дело стоя в пробке, в маршрутке или метро со смартфончика.

Как для такого объема проделанной работы стоит крайне недорого, ссылка ниже.

Одна из не многих в наше время игр, которая действительно заставляет подумать и провести в бурлении серого вещества не один час. 
Игра для головного мозга, а не для спинного!
Давайте поддержим разработчика и купим себе этот шедевр!!!

https://store.steampowered.com/app/544180/Orbox_C/

review:
Всем Deus Vult! Это я, Дмитрий Варгост, и у нас на обзоре игра под названием Orbox C.

Полная версия обзора тут: https://youtu.be/N9I_tZ6c3G4

Ну что сказать про эту игру? Несомненно у неё есть целый ряд плюсов. Начнем с очевидного: Визуальное оформление. Оно шикарно! Очень красочное и яркое, именно такое, какое необходимо многим головоломкам. Дальше идет музыкальное оформление. Это так-же что-то с чем-то. Идеально во время того, как обдумываешь ходы. Оно ненавязчивое и тем не менее цепляет и создает некий контраст с великолепным космическим фоном. В плане самого геймплея нет ничего революционного. Такие игры были и будут. В общем это очень хороший, а главное, качественный таймкиллер. Как по мне, так было бы круто выпустить эту игру ещё и на мобильные платформы. Спасибо разработчику за то, что он постарался над этой игрой, а ещё спасибо за ключ. Желаю вам успехов.

P.S. Подписывайтесь на канал Warghost Play. Канал заточен под инди игры. Всем любителям такого жанра добро пожаловать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030661609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1513813459}
review:
Orbox C is a very simplistic puzzle game set in space where you have to move a box to the exit. To move towards the exit you basically have to stop your block on other blocks in order to get to the exit without floating off into space. As you progress through the levels you will be greeted with different mechanics to keep the game interesting. For example on level 4 'angles' are introduced for the first time which are basically corner pieces which whizz you around the map in a 90 degree angle in a particular direction. The levels are very quick and usually only take a few minutes so the game makes you feel like you are progressing at a particularly fast rate which can make the player feel quite accomplished. There are 8 packs each consisting of 30 levels each so there are a ton of levels to sink your teeth into for a low affordable price. So far i have only played on the easy difficulty setting which still provides a slight challenge.

Here is a quick gameplay video for a better view of how the game actually works:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XxlKADQJlZg

PROS:

- fast
- tons of levels
- simple controls
- affordable price

CONS:

- simple
- not many options in the settings, for resolution etc
- backgrounds & music are mostly the same & could do with more variety

review:
Me contactaron directamente los devs por si podía mostrarlo en mi canal de YT. No es un canal muy grande, pero me gustó que contaran conmigo.
Orbox C es un juego de puzles, la mecánica no es nueva: hay que llegar a la meta, pudiendo movernos en cuatro direcciones y sólo deteniéndonos si un objeto fijo nos para, os hace rebotar o nos teletransporta. Los teleports siguen un patrón de color y al entrar por uno saldremos por otro del mismo color y en la misma dirección y sentido que tomábamos al entrar en el primero. Las que nos hacen rebotar lo hacen en 90º, por lo que siempre nos moveremos en el eje X e Y. Como decía no es nuevo, pero sí lo son algunas de las mecánicas que se van implementando y complicando a medida que avanzamos, como los rebotes y teleports que os comentaba, puertas que se cierran una vez pasamos por ellas y varias cosas más... Está muy bien para darle al coco y ejercitar un poco la mente, por si no nos apetece jugar a algo más complejo y sólo tenemos ganas de relajarnos y jugar a algo sencillo a nuestra bola.

review:
Wow, this one is a surprise. I was expecting another one of those cheap steam game with unachieved potential, but this game is really well done. It's a sliding block puzzle game, you get varying gimmicks every few stages to keep things fresh, but what really makes this game is the level design!

The difficulty ramps up juuust right, staying moderatly challenging while never becoming overwhelming. It leaves you room to learn and grow without ever feeling like it's holding your hand at all. The gimmicks are introduced in simple levels, and then gradually taken to challenges which really utilize their mechanics.

Really, if you're in the mood for a pure puzzle game, I don,t think you can go wrong with this one.

review:
I received this game as a free copy from the developers, and played it for the first time during a live stream on 9/18/17. 

Without question this is an instantly addictive casual game, much like say Bejeweled in some aspect. The controls are very basic, use your WASD keys (or direction keys) to move around with the goal of completing the level objectives. In many cases it is a matter of trial and error as you try to figure you through the game. There are a variety of game play elements from destroyable ice blocks, teleport portals, angled changing targets that provide challenges. The music is very soothing and keeps the mood calm and mellow, cutting down on the feelings of rage when one screws up.


Verdict: Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198208343720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1503167107}
review:
Orbox C is a strategy based puzzle game. Placing you in the position of a nice red box, and making you go through all sorts of obstacles to get to the next level. In Orbox C, you are presented with different ways of completing a level. Whether its by breaking all of the iceblocks in the level, activating all the switches in the level, going through portals to reach the final portal, or making it to the end of level zone.

In my time of playing Orbox C, I noticed a lot of great things about the game. The atmosphere of the game made me feel as if I were in space, floating around in an infinite galaxy on some sort of mission. Which to me felt PRETTY AWESOME! The game has an absolutely BEAUTIFUL soundtrack that cycles throughout the game, again adding to that floating around space vibe.

I think one of the things that surprised me about Orbox C, is the smart level designs throughout the game. I never would have thought that I would be writing down ways to pass the level on a piece of paper, which in my opinion makes this game a REALLY good puzzle game. 

When I played the game, I ran through no bugs, no glitches, it was a really good calm, smooth, and mysterious experience for me!

Overall. Orbox C is a great game for gamers that like to add a little puzzle or two into the mix, the soundtrack is beyond beautiful, and the puzzle maps are executed perfectly making you think about what you need to do, more and more!

review:
Do you like puzzle games? Do you like the vastness of space? Do you like PORTALS?! Then this is the game for you. 

Orbox C is a game that I quickly liked. Not only does this game have the player move around to get the Orbox to the end goal...thing, but it also has challenges like "Break All the Ice/Bombs, Collect all the Orbs, or Hit all four sides of the Sensor ball. As you go through each level, the difficulty gets ramped up little by little and forces the player to think a lot of the time. 

And it's all for 3 dollars?! That's practically a steal!

Pros:
- Innovative ideas for puzzles
- Good level design
- Good music
- Challenging Challenges
- Forces a player to think and learn from their mistakes
 - Shows players previous routes so you can see where you went wrong

Negatives: 
- One challenge being repeated (Break the Ice and Blow up the Bombs are same idea, but just a timer added to it)

review:
Orbox C is a Sci-Fi puzzle game, and not Sci-Fi in that it has many science fiction elements but that it takes place in space, with a square little probe guy trying to solve puzzles, IN SPACE! Who doesn't love a bit of space? I know I do. Regardless, there are a total of 7 packs of 30 levels each, each with varying levels of difficulty based on the name of the pack, it should be obvious on what is what. The hard difficulty pack definitely took me the longest to complete.

Now this game was given to me for free by the developer, and I have made the entire game into an LP on my channel, a link at the bottom of the review is available.

Within the LP I addressed some replayability concerns, that this game definitely doesnt offer, such as a star system - there is no way to really indicate how well you completed a level compared to everyone else, or what the min-max values would be. The lack of a star system defeats knowing there is a better solution available and the strive to get to it, and without it, you honestly dont know, and not many people wish to spend a few hours a level to see if they could potentially beat their previous score on it.

With that said, there are other options for replayability that I addressed in my LP such as a storyboard that changes between playthroughs similar to NIER or other games of the sort. This may be unheard of in puzzle games but it is a possibility to add repeat playthroughs each time, perhaps expanding the ability to add additional blocks types, etc.

There are no unlockables in this game outside of unlocking the next pack once the previous has been finished, no custom backgrounds, no alternate backgrounds, blocks, etc, forcing only one look for this game. It would have been interesting to see some of the other levels in alternate styles.

Settings are a bit lacking, I get a full screen/windowed, SFX and BGM on/off buttons. That is it. No options to set resolution (needed for recording to YouTube), nothing for skins, etc as I mentioned before, no in-depth video settings, or any of that sort. The settings are very straight forward and minimal.

Now, do I recommend this game? I do, for the price point it is offered at is perfectly fine for the amount of levels (>200) it offers and is a good time killer, however for those who want to replayability in this game, it may not be quite at that level for you unless you enjoy min-maxing on your own without knowing if there is a better solution available. Though keep in mind the lack of settings can drastically hinder ones desire to play this game if you're looking for customization via options.

For video playthrough along with commentary see: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLCNAkq5hBleiDV68c2ef8yuvx46O_W9yE

author: {'steamid': '76561198062232099', 'num_games_owned': 5821, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1497400929}
review:
At about 12:30am I received an email from Arseniy Shkljaev wanting me to shoot a gameplay video for Orbox C. I’d been working at the time and was due for a break. I hit the game’s Steam store page and immediately knew that I’d enjoy playing the game.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SycMDceA_co

[h1]What is Orbox C?[/h1]

You see, Orbox C is a puzzle game. Further, it looks like the type of game that has some action gameplay components to it. It requires critical thinking and quick thought. As one may suspect, this is entirely up my alley. I’ve played very similar games before – it’s not a new concept per se – but it’s a very interesting take on the genre.

[h1]Gameplay Mechanics Introduced Quickly[/h1]

One of the things that I love about this game is that gameplay mechanics are introduced at a relatively rapid pace. You’ll get a few levels of the same mechanic and then a new mechanic is introduced. This mechanic is generally not just a small change but something that adds significant depth. This prevents the game becoming tedious and increases the challenge.

[h1]Challenging Gameplay[/h1]

Speaking of increasing the challenge, the game isn’t as easy as it appears. Most levels had me repeating them to find the solution. However, at no time did I ever feel that any of my failures were unfair. The game kicked my ass until I logically moved through each level. 

[h1]Pretty Simplistic[/h1]

What makes the game magical, however, is that it is simplistic in its nature. But it gets it so right. It doesn’t strive to be more than what it is. Consequently, it delivers an all-around puzzle experience. 

[h1]Downsides?[/h1]

I’m used to writing these protracted reviews lately. My reviews generally are around the 1200+ word mark. Consequently, I carefully consider what I believe my readers will read and what they won’t read. There’s not much here to honestly criticize. My biggest criticism of the game is an external issue that I want to address on my business blog. I urge anyone who cares about marketing to read the blog. Hopefully, you’ll learn something.

Having said that, the game is lacking in overall polish and pizzazz for it to appeal to the mass audience. But it’s a $2.99 indie game made by two guys for crying out loud. It’s supposed to be a little rough around the edges. The point is it does exactly what it is intended to do. It has more than sufficient amount of content to satisfy fans and that’s what it’s done.
If the developers can clean up the game’s marketing image they’ll be doing extremely well for themselves. I hope that people keep an eye out for it during the upcoming Steam sale or indie bundles if they’re not willing to hand over the equivalent of a cup of coffee.

[h1]The Gamephasis Verdict[/h1]

Coffee or the game? The game’s going to last you longer than a cuppa. However, if you’re addicted that probably won’t matter. If you’re a serious puzzle gamer then get your hands on this hidden gem and have some fun.

Rating: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198065842379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1496165123}
review:
[h1]Review zu Orbox C[/h1]

Ihr könnt Euch gerne meine Video Review ansehen, falls Ihr keine Lust zu lesen habt:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mrtkwhZTKto

Orbox ist ein kleines Puzzlespiel, ähnlich wie die Zup! Spiele. Das Spielprinzip ist, seinen Hauptblock in eine bestimmte Richtung zu lenken und dadurch den Ausgang zu erreichen. Gestoppt wird dieser nur wann er bei einem andren Block oder ähnlichem ansteht. Danach kann man eine neue Richtung wählen. Die Levels fangen sehr leicht an und erklären Schritt für Schritt immer wieder neu dazu kommende Blöcke in jeweils einem neuen Level. So gibt es zum Beispiel Levels, wo man entweder alle blauen Kugeln berührt haben muss, eine Kugel an allen 4 Seiten aktiviert haben muss oder sämtliche Dynamitblöcke am Feld zum Explodieren gebracht hat.

Der Schwierigkeitsanstieg der Levels ist angenehm und kann je nach Schwierigkeitsgrad auch sehr fordernd werden. Aktuell gibt es 7 verschiedene Gamemodis und ein 8 soll laut Ingame Info wohl noch kommen, nachdem eine bestimmte Anzahl von Keys verkauft wurden. Eine Art Dankeschön Content, wann das Spiel genug Interessenten gefunden hat - zumindest verstehe ich das so. Insgesamt gilt es also zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt 210  levels zu bestehen. Wann ich dieses Game jetzt mit Zup! vergleiche, dass ich ebenfalls gespielt habe und auch ganz ok fand, muss ich sagen, dass Orbox schon etwas mehr Herausforderung bietet und nicht nur ein Spiel ist, mit dem man in 15 Minuten Hunderte Erfolge freischaltet. 

Insgesamt kann ich sagen, dass ich das Spiel für Zwischendurch ganz lustig finde und den Preis von 2,99€ auch für angemessen halte. Das Spielgefühl und die Handhabung ist sehr gut und auch die Soundkulisse passt sehr gut ins Spiel und gefällt mir. Es gibt 31 Steam Erfolge für die man jedoch schon etwas Zeit, Geduld und Räumliches Denken mitbringen sollte um auch wirklich auf seine 100% zu kommen. 

[b]PROs[/b]
[list]
[*]schönes Leveldesign obwohl schlicht gehalten
[*]stimmige Sounkulisse
[*]Steam Erfolge
[*]fairer Preis
[*]Sammelkarten
[*]keine Bugs
[*]gute Erklärung
[/list]

[b]CONTRAs[/b]
[list]
[*]keine Ingame Optionen für Lautstärke
[/list]

Wer gerne Puzzlespiele spielt kann hier fast nichts falsch machen. Ich persönlich verstehe nicht, wieso dieses Spiel noch so unbekannt ist. Ich kann dieses Spiel allen Rätselfreunden empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021489268', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1499038832}
review:
Presentation

While the graphics of this game are nothing special to look at, they are at least pretty nice. The particle effects are decent, the textures are fine, just overall what you would expect. The music is pretty good, but it is a little too loud. I could just turn down the volume of my computer, but that would be annoying if you were talking on discord or trying to record your own voice, etc. You can only turn the music off or on. I feel like it would be way better suited with a slider. The buttons on this game are huge, leading me to believe that this is most certainly just a mobile phone port, which is fine, at least it runs well and looks nice. Truly any computer made past 1998 should be able to run this game pretty well. 

Gameplay

For a puzzle game to work, it needs to meet two criteria for me. 1. The mechanics of the game are unique/ maps are well designed and 2. It should be easy enough to get into, but hard to beat. I think this game nails that personally. While the mechanics are nothing too special, the stages are very well done. Basically all you do is move a cube left, right, up, and down. The cube doesn't stop until it hits another surface, basically meaning you can shoot your cube into space and you'll have to start over.  There are a good amount of different objectives to complete to finish a level. Sometimes you just need to get to the end, sometimes you have to destroy blocks, collect orbs, or touch every side of a block. Some levels are a combination of 2 or 3 of those objectives. There's a good amount of variation, and the levels can be very challenging at times. 

Content

First things first, this game is only 3 bucks. Even keeping that in mind there is plenty of content in this game. There are 210 levels to complete across the various difficulties. Each level takes about a minute to complete, give or take depending on how good you are at completing the puzzles. Basically you get at least a few hours or gameplay from this game, about what you would expect. My goal for any game is to get an hour of gameplay of every dollar I spend. This is a game where you should be able to do that easily. Again, this is a puzzle game, so there really isn't anything other than puzzles included in this game.

Overall

This is a very solid game in every category. Doesn't do any one thing great, but it does everything very well. Plus, it's very cheap and will run on anything. If you are into puzzle games, or just want to kill some time, this isn't a bad buy at all.

review: Простое управление, но игра очень сложная. Некоторые уровни красивые и проходятся легко, над некоторыми приходится думать. author: {'steamid': '76561198016096893', 'num_games_owned': 11947, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1495044412}
review:
Инди-головоломка на логическое мышление. Передвигаем блок к выходу. Надо найти подходящий маршрут и не дать блоку улететь в космос.
Графика и музыка на достойном уровне. Тут просто не к чему придраться. Все красиво и качественно.
Игра порадовала разнообразием. По мере прохождения добавляются различные блоки, а задачи усложняются. Кроме простых блоков тут море всего. Телепорты, взрывающиеся бомбы, раскалывающийся лед, откидывающие платформы, блоки с датчиками на гранях.
Геймплей затягивает и заставляет пошевелить мозгами. 
Предыдущие ходы отмечаются на экране. Иногда это помогает в прохождении самых сложных уровней. 
Для любителей головоломок - это просто находка! Забавное и полезное развлечение для всей семьи. Отличная игра!

author: {'steamid': '76561198272374716', 'num_games_owned': 13029, 'num_reviews': 3562, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1495087419}
review:
[h1]«Orbox C»[/h1]
Логическая головоломка. Перемещаем блок в своеобразном лабиринте из различных платформ и предметов.

Для перехода на следующий уровень нужно выполнить поставленную задачу. Уровней много, они разнообразны. На некоторых надо передвинуть блок к выходу, на других - собрать все звезды, взорвать бомбы, разбить лед или активировать датчики. 

Всего в игре 210 уровней (7 режимов по 30 уровней в каждом). Планируется добавление восьмого режима под названием «Chain Reaction/Цепная реакция» и еще несколько обновлений. 

В «Orbox C» приятная графика, хороший дизайн, максимально простое управлении и не отвлекающая музыка. 
Это прекрасное средство убить время с пользой для мозгов! Множество уровней, увеличивающаяся сложность и разнообразные элементы не дадут заскучать даже самым искушенным фанатам жанра. Любителям головоломок рекомендую! Игра достойна пополнить вашу коллекцию.

review:
Not a bad game by any means. Generic, but if you like puzzles - I think it's worth it's price.
[h1]Video review + some gameplay[/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YJedrFeINSA

[h1]About the game[/h1]
Orbox C – it is a puzzle game, and if you remember these games where you could only move in a straight line before you encounter the next obstacle – yes, that’s one of the games like these.

[h1]Good stuff:[/h1]
-	Plenty of levels and the variety is actually quite impressive
-	The difficulty changes gradually, introducing the new features into the game: some tasks are extremely easy, others will require effort. Overall the difficulty increases, but when new level parts get introduced – it gets easier
-	The style is neat and clean and animations on object state changes are well done

[h1]Minor stuff, but still worth mentioning as it’s pretty annoying: [/h1]
-	Can not setup the music volume, and it’s pretty loud by default. Same for sounds. It’s either on or off.
-	Cannot quit the game directly during the level. You have to either leave fullscreen, or go back to main menu first.
-	Level ending animations seems desynced / chaotic, they just feel very random

review:
Orbox C is a really fun game! It's one of those puzzle games where you move an object and it can only move in 1 direction until it hits an obstacle and stops. Your goal is to find a way to make it to the goal, using this mechanic and others as well. There are bombs that are like timed obstaclce, ice that are 1 use obstacles, gates that close once you pass through, grow blocks that become an obstacle after passing them and so much more.
There are teleports, stars you must collect, sensors you must activate, missions that encompass these mechanics as ewll that you must complete.
Try it. You won't be disappointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009903346', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1491871148}
review:
I’d love you like a first son if you checked out my video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ed4GF8OIKQM

--
+ Loads of levels
+ Plenty of puzzle mechanics
+ Sweet soundtrack
+ Incredibly cheap for the amount of playtime you’re getting
- No real new innovation in terms of mechanics
--

Video Transcript : 

Before we can talk about Orbox C I think it only appropriate that we discuss Orbox and Orbox B. As you might have puzzled out from the names this is actually the third addition to the orbox catalog. The previous two titles are free browser flash games that can be found on a plethora of different websites. It appears the developers wanted to go down a different path this time and create a more substantial marketable game. Which brings us to today.

So being that this is the first game in their series they’re asking money for – what is it you get exactly. Well –  for starters you get 210 levels of varying difficulty packaged into a surprisingly good puzzle game.I should mention that I had never played nor heard of an orbox game before being approached for this review. So I had no idea what to expect.

I do try to keep a neutral attitude going into every game I review as I want to give a fair chance. That said, I was a little hesitant as I thought this was just going to be another generic puzzle game. It is – and - it isn’t. Let me explain

 I didn’t find anything that I felt I hadn’t seen before, however, it takes solid timeless mechanics that are continuously 
successful and implements them together. There’s nothing wrong with taking old ideas and recycling them. As long as it’s done well. Games have been doing this for billions of years why change now?

Alright, let me explain the basics to you. It’s quite simple- you’re a box and you can only move up, down, left, or right. You slide along a fixed path until you hit a block or encounter the endless pits of spcae. And that’s really all there is to it. Beyond that there’s five objectives that you may encounter within each level. Each one differs slightly and gives a good change of pace so that you’re not mindlessly repeating the same thing like a zombie.

Getting more specific - the five objectives you’ll face are the default get to the exit, destroy the bombs, collect the blue orbs, activating the sensors, and breaking ice blocks. Mind you, not all levels rely solely on just one of these. I’ve had several times that require multiple hurdles before I could complete the overall challenge.

Moving into the music – we’re greeted with a cool spacey set of tracks. It doesn’t feel out of place or get too repetitive – which if you’ve watched any of my other reviews you’d know is one of my biggest gripes. 


Difficulty is always key to a successfully puzzle game. And this game nails it right on the head. The challenge ranges drastically from quick and easy to mind-numbingly hard. I got halfway through normal for this review and really started to feel the heat ramping up. There was more than one puzzle that had me swearing and throwing empty bottles around my room. 

There’s several game modes or “packs” as this game likes to call them. They do group the game difficulties in with them, however, looking beyond the standard game - there’s a speed challenge if you’re feeling up to setting some records.

I care little for achievements and cards, but, I know there’s those out there who live for this kind of stuff. There’s currently 31 achievements that can be gained… They’re not particularly hard to get though seeing as I’m sitting at 55% with just a little over 2 hours of gameplay.

My final thoughts on this game are more positive than I would have thought. Honestly, I’m not that fond of puzzle games to begin with, but, I found that I didn’t have to push myself to complete this review. I’ll likely put a couple more hours into it which is impressive considering I don’t normally enjoy these types of games. It is a super casual game – I don’t even think that need be said, but, you’re getting about 5 or 6 hours of content for almost nothing. 

This game is currently up on steam for $3. I will say that there is a flash version out there – though – it only offers a fraction of the levels that you’re getting here. The developer has also setup a demo with a generous 30 levels for you to try out. So if you’re a puzzle fanatic then I’d recommend you at least check that out.

review:
First Impression Gameplay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6RLqweM4HTc&index=32&list=PL0ChqurHdrD4GDyzfEWF1egV0jL1CVSbq

Disclaimer:  Game key was given to me by developer.  Impressions of this game are genuine and not paid for.

Orbox C is a fun little puzzle game where your objective is to manipulate a box through space in order to accomplish certain objectives; such as arriving at a destination, collecting all "coins", etc.  The game starts off simple, where the only objective is to get your box to a target location by using other stationary blocks.  Every few levels a new mechanic is introduced to keep game play fresh (such as bombs, teleporters, 45 degree angles, collections, etc.).  

[h1]PROS[/h1]
-Fun concept
-New mechanics keep gameplay fresh
-Background music is good and doesn't distract from gameplay
-Art style is simplistic, but does not detract from gameplay
-Large amount of levels to keep you busy
-Difficulty progresses at a decent curve
-No bugs or graphical issues

[h1]CONS[/h1]
-Would have been nice to have a course "par" for moves on any certain level.  I wasn't sure if I was doing good or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993489052', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1486178250}
review:
A deceptively complex puzzle game with good music and a great price. You must move your box from the start to the goal, but the difficulty is that you go in a direction until you hit an obstacle. You have to plan your moves carefully to avoid flying off into the void or getting stuck, but a simple hit of 'r' restarts the stage. Each new element is added in with a tutorial on the stage they're introduced in, so you don't have to ask yourself 'what the heck is that' when a new thing appears on the puzzles.

If you like puzzle games and don't have a lot of money OrboxC is an excellent intersection of that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357900966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2581, 'last_played': 1708219959}
review:
First got into this game after watching another person’s video clip on this game where he went through the first few levels.  Took a look at the description on Steam, and given it’s only $2.99, decided to give this a try, as I’m into puzzle games.  No regrets on this decision, as this is a very nice puzzle game with many interesting elements in it.



Graphics:  When you open the game, it starts in full screen, but you can modify it to a smaller screen size, which I usually do.  Nice Sci-fi space graphics that change from level to level, so you’re not looking at the exact same background each time.  Sprites are simple and easily labeled so that you know what you’re looking at.


Sound:  Space-like music atmosphere is nice to listen to, but you can mute the music and sound effects at any time if you want to.  However, it may not hurt to have a few more soundtracks to choose from to listen to as you play to increase variety.


Controls:  Not too many options to have to worry about, as the controls are pretty self-explanatory.  In reality, all you’re using is the directions on the keyboard (WASD or up/left/down/right) and R to restart if you get stuck and can’t go out of bounds.  Controls are responsive with no lag, and if you push 5 directions ahead of time as you’re going through a long part, the Orbox will move in those directions with no loss or delay.  Orbox moves quickly, which is nice for the longer stages, as they flow better with no real delays.


Gameplay:  I'll break this down into pieces.
= It’s easy to get the hang of this game, but you’ll quickly see how the later puzzles make you think a bit.  Luckily, there are no enemies, and you can scout the board out before moving to see what you’re dealing with.  There are no lives, or game over, or anything like that to pressure the player, so feel free to try various things out.  If you go out of bounds, you’ll just go back to the start point (you’ll want to go out of bounds a lot anyway to get a few of the achievements).
= There are no time limits on the levels, so feel free to take as much time as needed to think through possible routes.  You’ll need to look ahead a bit in later levels to see any tricks that may be present.
= You can play a level as many times as you want, mainly to go for your best score, time, and moves (though the moves record is a bit glitched, as it doesn’t keep your best move score, but rather your score on the last time you beat the level).
= I like how in Easy, the levels start very simple with just getting to the goal.  A few levels in, new elements get introduced, one at a time.  This allows the player to learn how to best deal with these types of elements.  And as the levels progress, the player sees how these elements get combined together in having multiple tasks to do in a level.  The player will deal with anything from collecting stars to dealing with gates, grow blocks, sensors, ice, and bombs.  Nice job with the symmetry designs in most levels, giving a little more substance than just the basics to many of the levels.
= There are a whopping 210 levels, split into seven packs of 30 levels.  You start with the Easy pack and unlock more packs as you complete the packs you’re working on, which include Average, Normal, Hard, Easy 2, Speed, and Bonus.  There’s a spot for an eighth pack depending on feedback.  Difficulty progresses steadily on Easy -> Average -> Normal -> Hard.  I would guess Easy 2, Speed, and Bonus are somewhere in between in difficulty.



If you’re into puzzles, I would give this game a try.  $2.99 is a good price for the amount of content you get.  With the multiple puzzle elements and levels present, Orbox C makes for a solid puzzle game.
